path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/B4Real Smart Contract Final Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Wrong tokens purchased in case when decimals for input token > 18
findings.description: When input decimal value is greater than 18, wrong tokens are purchased due to incorrect exchange rate calculation.

findings.title: Crowdsale tokens not transferred to contract
findings.description: When updating the tokens allocated for the crowdsale, the actual number of tokens on the contract should also be updated. This should be done atomically in a single transaction.

findings.title: Withdraw fee bypass
findings.description: The user can bypass the withdrawal fee by collecting lesser fees than what he is paying.

findings.title: Unused function parameter
findings.description: Unused function parameters can make the code harder to read and understand, and may indicate a potential bug or unfinished implementation.

findings.title: Unused import
findings.description: The contract contains an unused import statement which can lead to unnecessary code and potential security risks.

findings.title: Solidity style guide
findings.description: Order of functions is not as per the solidity style guide.

findings.title: Update to latest solidity version
findings.description: Pragma version is not latest. As mentioned in the solidity docs: “When deploying contracts, you should use the latest released version of Solidity. Apart from exceptional cases, only the latest version receives security fixes. Furthermore, breaking changes as well as new features are introduced regularly.”
